column9: The Penguin

column1: by Jeramey Crawford <jacrawf@marko.net>
and
Rob Flynn <rob@marko.net>
Once upon a term'nal dreary, while I hack'ed, weak and weary,
Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten code--
While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a beeping,
As of some one gently feeping, feeping using damn talk mode.
'Tis some hacker, I muttered, "beeping using damn talk mode--
Only this. I hate talk mode."
Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak semester,
And college life wrought its terror as the school year became a bore.
Eagerly I wished for privledges;--higher access I sought to borrow
For my term'nal, unceasing sorrow--sorrow for a file called core--
For the rare and radiant files of .c the coders call the core--
Access Denied. Chown me more.
Open Source, did all mutter, when, with very little flirt and flutter,
In there stepped a stately Penguin of the saintly days of yore.
Quite a bit obese was he; having eaten lots of fish had he,
But, by deign of Finnish programmer, he sat in the middle of my floor--
Looking upon my dusty term'nal in the middle of my floor--
Came, and sat, and nothing more.
Then the tubby bird beguiling my sad code into shining,
By the free and open decorum of the message that it bore,
Though thy term'nal be dusty and slow, he said, "Linux be not craven!"
And thus I installed a new OS far from the proprietary
shore--
The kernel code open but documentation lacking on this shore.
Quoth the Penguin, "pipe grep more!"
Much I marvelled this rotund fowl to hear discourse so plainly,
Though its answer little meaning--little relevancy bore;
For we cannot help believing that no living human being
Ever yet was blessed with seeing bird in the middle of his floor--
Bird or beast sitting in the middle of his cluttered floor,
With such instructions as "pipe grep more."
But the Penguin, sitting lonely in that cluttered floor, spoke only
Those words, as if its soul in that instruction he did outpour.
Nothing more did he need utter; understood did I among that clutter--
Understood his command as I could scarcely do a few moments before--
I typed as furious as was willed me, understanding just a minute before.
Again the bird said "pipe grep more!"
Amazing! said I, "Penguin we will conquor the world if you will!
By the Network that interconnects us--by that Finn we both adore--
We'll take this very world by storm!" For now grasped I what he'd meant,
The thing I do while searching /usr/doc/* for that wond'rous lore--
Those compendiums of plaintext documentation and descriptive lore.
Quoth the Penguin, "pipe grep more!"
And the Penguin, never waddling, still is sitting, still is sitting
In the middle of my room and still very cluttered floor;
And his eyes have all the seeming of the free beer I am drinking
And the term'nal-light o'er him glowing throws his shadows on the floor;
And this OS from out the shadows that is pow'ring my term'nal on the floor
Shall be dominating--"Pipe grep more!"

column9: Ok, here's the deal on advancement in the guild. For the

column1: Wisdoms part, you're pretty much on your own as far as
how fast/slow you want your character to develop. I'll try
to keep an eye on things to make sure that no one is rp'ing
unrealistically (ie giving someone an herbal potion that
somehow instantly heals a broken leg), but beyond that, how
you rp is up to you. You can start as an apprentice and
make up a mentor for yourself. You can find another Wisdom
in the guild to teach you (I try to do it myself when I can,
but I'm in school an awful lot so my rp comes in spurts).
Basically, I just want to make sure that you can advance
and aren't just waiting on me so you can get some required
lesson. I trust all of you enough to rp your characters
intelligently. The only thing I ask is that you keep me
updated on your character's progress. That way, not only
do I know where everyone in the guild stands, but I can
update your rank if necessary.
For the Kin part, I have to be a little more strict. Because
in the books, the Kin really didn't train channelers, we
have to be careful how much a Kinswoman is taught, and
how far her ability and skill progress. Now granted, we
take a bit more liberty here in training women to channel,
but realize that training here proceeds much more slowly
than in the Tower, and is not nearly as complete. That
said, I am going to set a certain 'syllabus' if you will,
but it's really only a guide as to how far along in channeling
your ability has progressed. Based on your background, you
will start and different levels along the ladder. Each
lesson must be taught by someone who is at least two
lessons ahead of you for you to advance to the next skill
level in your channeling. Also note that these are
guidelines for your skill, not your strength. Remember that
you can techically know how to Heal even if you're not
strong enough in the One Power to actually do it.
The lessons/skill levels are as follows.
1. Introduction to the One Power/Basics of channeling
This is a non-channeling lesson. Basically, it covers all
the basic information about channeling. what Saidin/Saidar
are, the dangers of channeling, some examples of what can
be done, what channeling is, what weaving is, etc. You
cannot grasp or channel at this level.
2. Grasping/Releasing
Fairly self explanatory. At this level, you can grasp and
release, but cannot yet channel the One Power.
3. Single flow channeling/simple weaves
The basics of channeling simple flows of the five powers.
At this level, you can do very basic weaves which involve
only one of the five powers. (ie a ball of spirit, a breeze
of air, lighting a candle, etc.)
4. Advanced weaving with a single flow
At this level, you are getting fairly proficient with your
channeling, but can still only handle one flow at a time.
Basically like the one above, but with bigger flows that
can have a bit more of an effect. (ie. A club of air,
a ball of fire, shielding, etc.) At this level, linking
is also taught.
5. Multi flow channeling/simple weaves
At this stage, you've learned enough control that you can
add a second, third, or even more flows to your weave.
However, because of the added strain of multiple flows,
you are again limited to simple weaves if you try to use
multiple flows. At this level, you also learn the process
of guiding someone through breaking a block.
6. Advanced weaving with multiple flows
You're quite skilled in channeling at this point. You have
good control over your flows, and are able to combine them
in increasingly difficult weaves. (gentle/sever) At the
top of this level is Healing.
Please remember this while you're training. Learning about
the Kin as a group is a function of how long you've been
under the tutelage of a Kinswoman, not necessary how well
trained you are. You can be in training, and still not
know about the Kin. Remember, it's a big risk telling our
secret. So just because you're being trained to channel, don't
assume you know about the Kin. Knowledge of the Kin will
only come through RP. If you haven't found out IC'ly from
another player, don't assume you know it.
Also note that you DO NOT have to complete all six lessons
to be considered a full Kinswoman. There are Kinswomen who
represent skill levels ranging the full range. Once you
are IC'ly told about the Kin, you are brought in and are
considered to be a full Kinswoman. Because remember, status
in the Kin is based on age, not skill or strength in the power.
You could potentially be like Morgase, never advance beyond
lesson 3, yet still rank higher in the Kin than someone at
level 6 so long as you were older. Just something to keep
in mind.

column9: Hello folks, I got to thinking last evening and was pondering the idea

column1: of a major, longer term tournament and was wondering about thoughts,
suggestions, or comments ya'll might have. I'll give a rough outline
of what I was considering now (one idea considers the possibility of
a completed/semi-completed combat code which may be optimistic, and
alternatives will be planned ;))
So, anyways, what I was thinking of was an IC tournament in the Caemlyn
area involving 4 events and spanning a period of a month RL, each with an
IC prize and making use of character WM (now that people have had a chance
to make use of the new system if they want and so forth, and to encourage
others). The month long tournament would be announced an additional month
in advance to give people a chance to OOCly enter/prepare, and to generate
RP, such as allowing people time to ICly travel to Caemlyn if they wish,
the nobles to sponsor champions, the crafters/artisans to prepare wares
or events, and so on. I want this to be a major IC event, not just the
quickie week long tournament that used to be as much OOC as IC. I also
want people to be able to NPC contestants if they can't make it themselves
ICly, of equal or lesser comparable WM skill. An NPC contestant who wins
the tournament would also ICly win the prize, not the PC playing them
(perhaps something could be arranged a bit). At the end of the tournament
I'd like to see a ball/festival/party/whatever potentially generated by
the players and another department in which the prizes will be awarded and
such. All that said, I'll give a brief run over on my ideas for the 4
combat events.
1) Wrestling - I don't think this has been done in a tournament before,

column9: Hey, all.  Given all the neat things we learned from MM3 about how not to implement

column1: large projects, I'm generally conservative in how much we discuss projects once
they'v moved past the conceptual phase and are actually being coded.  However,
it's been brought to our attention that some misconceptions are circulating
regarding combat, so I'm going to post some general information to clear things
up.
`6What's combat going to be like?`7
Firstly, combat is going to be a form and skill based system again, with
emphasis on balancing IC realism and customizable gameplay.  The grid
is gone, since it was unpopular and caused enormous problems with retainers
and mobs and multiple groups fighting each other.  It has three major
settings with varying degrees of speed and user interaction.  All settings
allow for users to adjust how their character fights at any time prior to,
or during combat.  They range from manual (similar to turn based combat,
for those few players who want something to supplement their emotes in an
emote fight) to automatic, which is quick and doesn't hang on waiting
for players to input commands.  For policy purposes, priority goes to the
fastest setting (manual, semi-auto or automatic) of any combatant, so
that when someone starts supermanning to the point of being ridiculous,
a more senior combatant can once again say 'eff this' and pkill the
bugger in short order.  Provided that legal RP leads up to a pkill, we'll
be enforcing it as an IC death, as we did in MM2.
`6Does this mean we're getting away from determining levels from RPing?`7
No.  You do not have to run around killing mobs as a prerequisite to
having a decent pfile.  Levels will still be determined through RP, and
code power will still be determined largely by RP and RP ability.  We're
just adding more ways to represent a character's abilities, and some of
them (such as combat skills) can be increased by use.  The emphasis is
still on RP, but you will definitely benefit from taking part in code
combat with mobs and other players.  And obviously, the more code combat
you're involved in, the better your character gets at it.
`6What's changing?`7
We're bringing back options that allow you to control your style and how
much you're exerting yourself.  The code also tracks the number and types
of wounds to bodyparts, such that the wounds you take hamper your ability
to fight.  A character's combat status includes a number of new, more IC
fields, although this info is presented to players in a more general
fashion than the complicated number-tracking that the code handles.  You
can eventually pass out and/or die from losing blood over one good stab
wound even if your HPs are still high, pass out from fatigue, and walk
away with wounds that heal over time (or kill you later) and that can be
healed with channeling or first-aid skills.  If your right arm is numb or
broken, it makes it kinda hard to hit people, and if your sword hand is
miserably gashed up, you won't be able to wield your weapon effectively.
The entire system is based on mods, though, so it's rarely as simple as
saying 'your leg is broken, so now you are barred from doing this and
this'.  There's a chance you can pull almost anything off at any time,
even if you hurt yourself trying.  It's a system of critical hits and
a lot of mods and as much realism as we can cram into it while still
enhancing gameplay, instead of making the system unwieldy and confusing.
We'll also be recalculating things like stats and HPs, since currently
they're not really relative to anytihng concrete, and, IMO, are kinda
stupid.  25 strength means what, exactly? Nobody's code stats represent
their IC characters anymore, so we're endeavoring to fix that.  Combat
will be much more realistic than just keeping track of the number of
time you can get stabbed before you die, and deals with a lot more than
simple HP totals (which are now mainly just invisible benchmarks for
other calculations).
`6Bah, I liked Turn Based Combat.  Lets just finish that, shall we?`7
Once we get the skeleton system (meaning a fully running combat system
but without all of the details we've laid the foundation for), code
combat will be brought in.  We will continue adding to it extensively
as we go.  If you've got any questions/comments, feel free to ask.
We're gonna get real grouchy real fast if anybody says 'this sucks,
lets keep TBC' tho.
Also, Fredrik rocks.
Lastly, no proofreading took place at any time on this.  It's not that
Nico doesn't know how to type, it's that he just doesn't care. *sage*
-Nico, Duren and Fredrik, the Man

column1: Ok Guys, tell me what you think about this:  I'm think we should consider
'opening up' some of Tyme's code.  Why?  To expand our pool of brain power.  I
realize most players probably won't be able to take advtantage of it, but I
notice we have alot of people who are intelligent CS majors, but aren't really
good enough or trustworthy enough to be given full access to the code.  By
opening up areas of the code, such as afflcitions, we can harness the brain
power of people who we wouldn't normally be able.  How?  Set up a mailing list
of some sort, and allow people to submit patches.  One of Tymes official coders
will give it a good look over, and if it seems like a good thing to have, and if
the Head Coder agrees, it could get patched in.  Even if we turn away most
patches, this could give us alot of ideas.  Just because a patch in and of
itself is bad, doesn't necessarily mean the idea behind it is bad, it just needs
better coding.  Areas of code I think would be good canidates for this:
Afflictions code:  Let players send in patches for new afflcitions.
Skills/Spells:  Let players send in patches for new skills.
Arbitrary commands:  Things like the score sheet, look, scan, etc.  Stupid
little small details that most coders don't worry themselves
with.
Possibly others?
Be advised, I am fully aware of all the downsides to something like this.  It
still means work for coders, because we'd have to review each patch submitted in
detail.  It may also be a pain to set up, since all shared code would have to be
moved into seperate files from un-shared code.  For legal reasons, we'd need
some sort of license.  Also, to allow players to compile/test their code, we'd
have to build and release some form of library that contains the un-shared
functions.  So the player could compile his .c files into .o files, then link
that against the 'big library' to get a functioning MUD server.  We'd also need
to place some hard coded limits on that as well, to prevent people from running
rogue copies of MM3, IE, hard code it so that only 3 players can connect at a
time, hard code like 4 rooms, and hard code a simple pfile.
I realize it'd be awkward to setup, has some risks assosiated and may be a
general pain.  But I think we could increase new code changes enough to make it
worthwhile.  Thoughts?
-Duren

column9: Yeah, I'd say documentation would be the biggest hurdle here.  But,

column9: What I'm posting here are some old quest ideas from the old days when I was

column1: involved with Events as an IMM.  They were good ideas that for one reason or
another never got put into motion.  Also, I want to be clear that I don't get
credit for these, it goes to the people who first send them to me.  This one
was an idea from Timmy, at that time the head WM Imm.
The Lost Library
I'd like to resurrect an old event-idea I was spawning on back
during my days as an event immortal: it was a large-scale Role-play
scenario that would involve many major guilds in a form of "treasure
hunt" in lack of a better word.
The event would revolve around a mythical library, rumored to
contain volumes of knowledge from the Age of Legends believed to be
lost. A most alluring keep for many: let me briefly elaborate the
main guilds that should have some interest in this.
-White Tower-
Naturally: they always stick their nose into things :P And with
something like this that could contain vital information for them
to use in the struggle against the Shadow, it should most certainly
provide with some temptation.
-Daes Dae'mar-
They want power, most of them: some would be curious about this
treasure, others could see it as a chance of gaining larger influence
and strengthen their position.
-Whitecloak-
Spanish Inquisition? They don't want witchcraft knowledge like
this to slip out into the open, and they'd definitely wouldn't want
the Aes Sedai to get their hands on it either, most certainly.
-Darkfriends-
Old knowledge would be a valuable weapon against their enemies:
enough said.
-Merchants-
Maybe a small bystander primarily, but given their connections
and their trade, they may get themselves involved for their own
reasons.
Of course, there is nothing to say that any guild or individual
couldn't participate, but these would be the more "major" factions
involved, that would gain the most by pursuing this mythical keep.
-How to get them all involved-
Still sketchy: I was considering a "secret society" that are
responsible for keeping the library safe: either they accidentally
leaked information to various parts, or they deliberately did so.
Clues in form of notes, small RP-sessions and similar endeavors
would be used to make most of these factions aware of the keep's
existence.
-How do we keep it running?-
In my experience, large RP-processes are hard to organize: hence
we would need to make it self-sufficient as much as possible. The
event itself would be a treasure hunt, basically: by providing clues
to places where more clues are to be found, we monitor the progress
of each by a sound usage of the mail system.
I.e. participant X from guild Y has reasoned out that the next
clue is located in Illian. He mails us with this information, stating
how he came to that conclusion and what he intends to do about it:
either we arrange a small RP-session, or me wail the results to him
on what he may have found.
Although the latter may not sound that exciting, there would still
be enough RP-sessions to be satisfactory for the majority of the
participants, methinks: the less scheduled events, the better: lets
try and be impulsive?
-Treasures?-
I'm fully aware of that knowledge from the AoL may be a too
powerful item to release onto the Mud :P I'm not proposing that
the end result would necessarily be just this: maybe a few fragments
that we could be lenient in supplying? Maybe some other treasures,
like Angreal's or something similar? Maybe the Library has a form
of self-destruction weave woven around it so that no one get nil?
You decide.
Anyway, this is just a brief summary of the idea: I've got more
details in case you are interested. What say you? I'd help running
this, just so you know.

column1: Question:
Is the White Tower currently aware of any way to
completely dissolve/undo the bond between an Aes
Sedai and her Warder so that the link no longer
exists and all the positive and negative effects
of the bond are removed?
Robert Jordan Answers:
Yes, they are. It is called releasing a Warder,
and an Aes Sedai who is very old or injured so
badly that she knows she is going to die will,
if she has the strength, release him so he doesn't
suffer from her death. This does require the two
of them to be together, and a little more time that
laying on the bond. If they are physically apart,
or she doesn't have enough time or strength
remaining, touch on him.
It has also been used to get rid of a Warder who
proved to be unsuitable in some way, such as a man
who is discovered to be a thief or who takes
reckless chances, a fighter of duels who won't
stop without the bond being used to force him.
No sister is going to want a Warder who will risk
getting himself killed, with all the attendant
results to her, for no very good reason.
Although use of the bond in that way (controlling)
was not unknown in the past, it came to be regarded
as a form of Compulsion to use it so except in the
slightest forms. Besides, using the bond to control
a Warder all the time is a lot of work. An Aes Sedai
wants somebody who can watch her back and keep it safe,
not somebody she has to work on all the time. (Which
is one of the reasons Aes Sedai stopped bonding men
against their will. Not ethical concerns or ethical
growth, I'm afraid; it was just not very practical
really) Better simply to release the fellow who can't
measure up and find another who will.
By the by, releasing a Warder except for cause (the
Aes Sedai's imminent death, his own unsuitability) or
because he has asked for release is something that JUST
IS NOT DONE! It would gain the sister considerable
opprobrium from other sisters. A sister certainly
would be looked at askance if she released a Warder
who was dying, for example, just to avoid the effects
on her of his death. When an Aes Sedai bonds a Warder,
she is expected to buy in for the full ride. For that
matter, releasing him for unsuitability is considered
to reflect on the sister's judgement. She should have
known better about him from the start.
Posted by,
--Me.

column1: HOW TO CREATE A NEW SHIP
01. Write the rooms for the ship itself and be sure to include the following rooms:
a)The room with the boarding plank...must be flagged with PLANK flag.
b)The room that the ship will be steered from...must be flagged HELM flag

200 to 215 + 230 to 240...you should use a range like 41800 to 41885 with none of the rooms in

or WATER_NOSWIM....it should however be one room away from a room with either of those sector

column9: If you have a character of High Seat rank or higher, or a

column1: military character of high rank, such as the Captain-General
or the Marshal-General, much more will be expected of you than
those of lower ranks.  Such positions come with responsibility,
and while the position is responsibility, it can still be a
lot of fun.  There are a few instances when you must come to
your GL first, before you take certain courses of action.  I
will go into further detail below.
`#M`3arriage`7
If your high-ranking character wishes to marry, you MUST come
to me first so that I can be aware of your intention, and make
any appropriate changes to rank.  I am even willing to NPC a
Magistrate or other representative to do the ceremony if it is
so desired. High ranking characters must follow the guidelines
of the country in which he or she resides.  For instance, if
it is inappropriate for a Prince to marry a commoner, such a
marriage will not be allowed unless you wish to lose your rank.
`#T`3roop `#M`3ovements`7
If you are planning any sort of troop movement which goes
beyond your normal number of retainers, you must come to your
GL first.  I will need to know exactly how many troops you are
planning to move, where you are planning to move them, and why.
You must also submit this information to the War Department, or
`1your troops will not be moved!`7  If you fail to notify the
GLs or the War Department, it will only cause confusion and
may result in nulled roleplay and delays in your plans.  If
you follow the guidelines, it will make things much smoother.
You must also notify the rulers of the nations your army will
be passing through so that they may choose whether or not to
take action, and what type of action they wish to take.  This
is why I, as the GL, need to know so that such movements can
be done in a realistic manner.
`#D`3eath`7
If you are a high-ranking character, and you have been ICly
killed, or if you simply wish to kill off your character, I
need to be aware that it has been done, naturally, and whether
or not you will have a character of similar status in the guild
to replace your killed PC.  At this point, having obtained a high
ranking character, it is generally likely that you can have a
character of similar rank, unless you conducted yourself poorly
at the end.  You may not, however, create a character with the
exact same rank you lost.  For instance, if you die as Queen
of Cairhien, you cannot create a new character who is also Queen
of Cairhien.  However, you might be Queen of Illian, or Princess
of Arad Doman, or a similiarly high rank in another realm. Or,
you can create a lower-ranked character in the same realm, and
try to work your way back up to the position through roleplay,
provided you are not doing so as OOC vengeance against your IC
killer.
`3Major Changes/Events`7
Any major changes or events you are planning, as a high-ranked
character, should also be run by me first as well. These are
things such as starting a war with Amadicia, or remodeling the
Sun Palace ICly, or building a memorial garden, etc.  Mostly, such
things can simply be sent to me in the form of an update, which
I can have posted.  Also, I am more than willing to help further
your plots and events by NPCing or otherwise making connections
for you that you may not have otherwise had.
For major changes or events, it would be VERY WISE to LOG any
and all roleplay pertaining to it, in case someone has a gripe.
That way, you have it all documented, and can present it to me
if I need it in order to clarify something or resolve any
misunderstandings.  Hold onto all your mails and correspondance
in regards to such events, because you never know when you will
need them!
`#D`3uty`7
As a high-ranking character, you have a duty to your country,
and this cannot be stressed enough.  If you are a High Seat,
for the most part, you will be expected to remain in your own
homeland, overseeing House matters, and assisting your monarch
in the running of the realm.  If you are a Prince or Princess,
you may have a bit more freedom, because you can act as a sort
of ambassador, or act on behalf of your monarch.  If you are
a monarch, leaving your homeland should be a very `1rare`7 thing
and should definitely be run by your GL first.  You must have
good cause to do so.  If any high-ranking character leaves his

else who can.

column9: A few things:

column1: - I created a CVS respository for the lib and public_html directories.
- I setup remote CVS.  If you want to be able to work offline on files in src, public_html, or lib,
see http://tymemud.com/coding/  for directions on setting this up.
- I configured MySQL to allow remote connections, and I also locked down the server a little by setting
a root password.  From now on, you'll need to do: "mysql -uroot Tyme -p" and enter the password to
access the database.  (I set it to the same as the shell password.)
- I updated the MM32 code to compile on the GCC 3.3.x compiler, as well as maintaining compatibility
with version 2.9.6.  Hopefully this means that no matter what server the code needs to run on, it
should compile.
As a side note, the world files are included in the lib repository, and currently hold the MM3 version
of world files.  I setup the builderport directory so that it's able to commit to this repository, so
from now on, when areas are created on builderport, and need to be copied over to the live port, they
should be done just like source code is done.  You commit the copy on builderport to the repository,
then you cd to the world folder on the live port, and do a cvs update.  This makes it easier to maintain
'versions' of the various world files, and easier to revert back to an older version if we want to.
Since public_html is also in the repository, the same idea applies there.  Anytime you want to make a
change to the website, you should probably avoid making it directly in the public_html folder.  Go to
your own public_html folder under your own username (IE: /Muds/Tyme/home/duke/public_html).  Check
out a copy of public_html using remote CVS, make your changes, test them, then commit them back
to the repository once you're sure they work OK.  Then login as tyme, and do a cvs update
in the main public_html.
-Duren

column9: Alright everybody, got some big news that will either infuriate or excite.  With

column1: the goal of fixing some things that are broken, stupid, or just hard for players,
we're making some large-scale adjustments.  The result is, we hope, that our
guilds (for both current and hopefully future members) will be in a better
position to interact with each other.  Some large-scale auths are involved, and
I don't expect everybody will like them.  I feel they are good solutions, and
even though the implementation is a little premature, it worked out ok for the
ubermap and plus it's going to be harder if we wait until we have more players.
Here goes.
Through act of Luc and I, Altara has fallen to the SC, and the country of
Murandy is all but won.  Northern Altara is under contention from the DS and
Whitecloaks.  Ghealdan remains home to the Dragonsworn (even though we don't
currently have any), and the WC still control Amadicia.  Murandy's fall will
be presented through updates in the immediate future (its fall is imminent).
Because of the effort it took to conquer Altara and Murandy, the SC will be
forced to spend a long time regrouping and gathering their resources,
which will allow for more actual RP instead of aggressive attacks into

check your maps, players can still travel freely between Caemlyn and Illian,

column9: I say this because, while it has been pointed out that Murandy was

column1: weak, and therefore an easy target, it also stands as buffer
between the Seanchan and Andor.  This means that one of the
strongest states in Randland has no direct connections to Seanchan
land, and is not 'threatened' by them yet, thus will more than
likely hesitate to consider them a threat upon which action is
necessary.  With the elimination of Amadicia instead, they have
both closed a gap in their lines, as well as having eliminated one
of the more dangerous threats to their flank.
Taking Altara and Amadicia would then leave them with only one
flank in danger from an appreciable enemy, that is to say Illian.
Whereas, this attack on Murandy, rather than Amadicia has left
them with an appreciable threat on three fronts, as well as a less
organized force on a fourth front.  A move that I think many would
consider dangerous.
I realize that the choices made in this case were for the benefit
of RP, rather than strategy, a way to introduce Seanchan to
Caemlyn so that they could RP.  I would put forth however that
more likely this will lead to RP that will end badly for those who
choose to play Seanchan.  My reason for saying this is thus, with
Murandy between Andor and Seanchan held territories, there was no
percieved direct threat, and thus Seanchan scouts would not be in
direct danger simply for being in Caemlyn.  With Seanchan
encroaching on Andoran borders, and refugees entering the city,
anyone who is connected with the Seanchan will be considered as a
direct threat to the Crown the moment they step into the country,
and will be treated as such by the authorities.  This will lead to
imprisonment at best for those discovered(Seanchan are not
unrecognizable), and death for most who are caught as spies.
I have some other problems regarding the planned RP and the
characters who will be involved in our city, but those are
personal issues that I can explain if you ask me directly.
Anyway, these are my thoughts,
Jerod

column9: Chain of command can be a difficult concept with two separate chains of

column1: command within the guild (Gaidin and Tower Guard), as ICly, the chains
of command are interlinked. This is how it works:
1. Gaidin trainee ranks and Tower Guard soldier ranks have no authority
over each other. Thus, a Bannerman can't tell an Initiate Trainee
what to do and vice-versa.
2. Tower Guard officer ranks -may- tell Gaidin trainee ranks what to do,
but this is only in extreme circumstances. Generally, they don't.
3. Gaidin graduate ranks have direct authority over Tower Guard soldier
ranks, without exception. This situation will be encountered often,
such as when a Gaidin orders a Tower Guard to apprehend someone or
something of that nature.
4. Gaidin graduate ranks and Tower Guard officer ranks have no authority
over each other. If there is a dispute, generally it is resolved by
going over the other's head (i.e. to a more senior Tower Guard officer
or, in the other case, to go to the Master at Arms about the Gaidin).
These rules are written in stone and will be enforced so that there are
boundaries that define exactly how the two chains of command interact.
Thank you for following these guidelines.
Balinor

column9: Hiya all,

column1: Sorry I've been away so long.  Been dealing with some RL
issues.  Things are back on track again now, so I should be available
more often if anyone needs me for anything.  I'm usually here in the
evenings between 6 pm to Midnight CST and on the weekends.  I'd still
like to see this game come back to life, and will be starting work on
my building projects again.  If anyone wants to help with building
projects, please let me know.  Here is a list of what needs to be done:
`5Mobprogs`7 - We need people willing to learn how to do mobprogs to make
automated quests for players to do while the player base is low.  These
quests could offer such things as teaching skills, scavenger hunts, mobs
that have different reactions to characters based on who they are, etc.
These are very important for us right now, because it will give something
to players to do while we await the finishing of the new combat system.
`2Ubermap`7 - There are a lot of rooms that need to be desced on the Ubermap.
The Ubermap is basically a nearly-to-scale map of the area between Tar
Valon, Cairhien and Andor according to RJ's maps in the books.  Every
square of it is going to be open for players to explore, and it will be
important to pay attention to room descriptions in order to figure out
where you are.  We need people who are willing to just do descriptions.
The rooms are already set up.  We'll give you access to the Ubermap, and
then you can desc your heart out.  Must be willing to do mundane things
like forests, rivers, fields, farmlands, hills, etc. though of course
you're welcome to add interesting things such as bridges or other cool
landmarks here and there to help folks find their way around.  The Uber-
map is currently only 15 percent complete so we really need help with it.
`3Cairhien`7 - Cairhien needs to be gone over with a fine-tooth comb to
make sure all the rooms connect properly.  The Sun Palace is also in
need of revamping, as it apparently has stairs that go nowhere.  Also,
there are a number of shops that are not linked to the Cairhien grid
any longer and those need to be re-linked.  Any player interested in
helping out with Cairhien, please let me know and this project will be
delegated out.  Cairhien is currently about 75 percent complete
`1Caemlyn`7 - This is again where mobprogs come in.  We want to make some
newbie-friendly quests for new players to get to know their way around
and to generally make Caemlyn a more fun place to explore.  Some descs
of rooms could probably be revamped as well.  This project is only about
10 percent finished.
Things I am Finishing:
`6Non-Combat Eq`7 - I am currently going over all the wearable items and
making sure that they don't have any typos and things like that.  This
is about 50 percent done and will likely be finished in the next month.
`&White Tower`7 - The White Tower is nearly complete, about 90 percent.  Just need
to put in a few more automated quests/mobprogs, finish the basement area
and need to finish the Warder Tower.  Elaida's Palace is nearly complete.
A maze has been added to the gardens.  I will be finishing the White Tower
area hopefully in the next month, if not sooner.
`!Shops`7 - Once the non-combat equipment is created and proofread, shops need
to be made and/or edited in Caemlyn and Tar Valon (and eventually Cairhien
once it's relinked again) so that players can purchase the new equipment.
There will be shops dedicated specifically to newbie equipment, and shops
dedicated to various equipment slots.  This project has not yet been
started.
So there you have it.  My Building Report.  I would appreciate help from anyone
who cares to assist.  There is still much to be done, but as you can see, we know
what needs to be done.  We just need to do it. :)
Ayasha

column9: For anyone who has trouble accessing Tyme from their tablet, smartphone, or behind firewalls:

column1: I developed a web based client that does not use any direct TCP connection to the game at all.  So if
you have any internet access at all, you can access the game at:
http://tymemud.com/ajaxclient.php
The other nice thing about the ajax client is that it can piggyback an existing connection.
So you can stay online at home, go to work, load up the page and see what would be on your
screen at home.
The ajax client does create a lot of database data, as all text displayed on your screen gets
dumped into a MySQL database where the webpage can load it up.  For this reason you have to
specifically enable it in game by typing:
option ajax
Have fun!
-Duren

column9: `2Warder Template #1 `7- The Righteous

column1: These are the more common types of candidates seeking to train with
the warders. These are people with high ideals and goals for themselves
and their own place in the Wheel.
`2Warder Template #2 `7- The Romantic
Dazzled by old stories of heroism against the battle of evil, the
Romantic dwells within all the elaborated myths about the Gaidin.
`2Warder Template #3 `7- The Dutiful
There is little passion outside the cold brim of duty, and these are in
truth the "Cold, Leashed Dogs" of the Gaidin that most people hear
about. They often see themselves more as tools than maybe the Aes
Sedai does, not caring much for their own value and often quite morbid
in nature.
`2Warder Template #4 `7- The Cryptic
Many kinds of people fit into this category, yet what all of these are
bound to have in common is the fact that at one point or another,
something happened in their lives that made them feel like repaying it
in a way by joining the Gaidin.
`*TG\Army Template #1 `7- The Devoted
Aside from the regular Warder-candidates there are those who seek a
more structured life-style, the Tower Guard or the Army instead. The
guidance to this service is like a beacon for these, clearing the path
and allowing the person to tread upon the lane of Light within the ranks.
`*TG\Army Template #2 `7- The Unemployed
These men are often rather simple in terms of personality.  They are often
unhindered by glorious desires to become something special, like heroes or
high-ranking officers: they merely wish to earn a living by the means available.
`*TG\Army Template #3 `7- The Obligated (Honor and Tradition, Nobles)
The Nobility are often in the habit of sending their sons to be trained
at the White Tower. These sons are sometimes the heirs of their
families and thus never intend to bond.  Some remain as Tower Guard
while others may return home to their families.
`^*`&IMPORTANT NOTE`^*`7
You MUST submit your background to the Daes GL for approval of
the noble connection BEFORE sending it to the Tower GLs.
If you would like more information on a template please contact the
Tower GLs.

`8"`#Wolfkin`8"`7
This thread on template show will be dedicated to the Wolfkin
guild and their character templates. Each template will be
placed on the same thread as a new comment to keep things
more compact and easy to use. Before continuing on, here is a
short explanation of who the Wolfkin are.
`#"`3It was once said that before even the Nym and the Ogier were
born into the world, man had a link with the beasts of the earth,
and in particular, the wolves. Although these men and women took
no formal name, they are lumped under the title of 'Wolfkin.'
Somehow, they have uncovered their link with their furry
friends once more, allowing their minds to somehow communicate
with the wolves as well as to enter the World of Dreams, known
as Tel'Aran'Rhiod to those schooled in esoteric lores. The
danger of being a Wolfkin is all too clear, though. As has
happened from time to time, a person may fall victim to the
lust of the wolfish side and embrace their animality rather
than their humanity. To most knowledge, once that bridge is
crossed it burns as well. With the Wolfkin, they must always
balance carefully the instincts of an animal with the reason
of a human, a delicate line to walk.`#"`7
`#S`3eeker `#R`3equirements`7
`!Exclusive Wolfkin Seekers`7
`1Step 1)`7 Decide to seek Wolfkin, make it your overwheming passion ;)
`1Step 2)`7 Come up with an appropriate background and submit this to the
`7        GL's (currently Miniver and Lironah) for approval.
`1Step 3)`7 Find yourself `#3`7 sponsors.
`1Step 4)`7 Get guilded, be the envy of all your friends.
`!Multiguilded Wolfkin Seekers`7
`1Step 1)`7 Realise that being Wolfkin doesn't just mean cool new
abilities for your character to use in their RP. It involves
effort, thought, and skill to execute properly.
`1Step 2)`7 Submit a background and justification as to how your
character might manage to be both Wolfkin and a member of your
other guild without sacrificing skill in one or the other.
`1Step 3)`7 Get authorization from all GL's of your current guilds then
wait for a response from the Wolfkin GLs. They will discuss
this with your current GLs and likely ask around amoung others
as to your skill and ability.
`1Step 4)`7 Remember that even do you get authorization in all earlier
steps that is still no guarentee you can or will be guilded.
The Wolfkin GL will assign requirements as appropriate, be
they sponsors, RP logs, RP levels, whatever might be deemed
appropriate for your personal situation. Your requirements may
not be the same as another persons. They may seem more
difficult, or not, but they will be geared towards not only
testing your abilities but also your commitment and desire.
`1Step 5)`7 Get guilded, if you're lucky ;)
`!Note:`7 Do not RP having goldeneyes until you have been given
express permission from the GLs.
`1THE MAD DOG`7
`8Quote: `!"`1For a moment Noam stared at the opening. Abruptly he darted
out of the cage, running on all fours, but with surprising
agility. Out of the cage, out of the shed, and into the night.`!"`7
Book Example: Noam (The Dragon Reborn, Ch. 8 "Jarra")
Unfortunately, though no one yet really understands why, some who
join with the wolves can not manage to control it and their humanity
crumbles away like the bank of a raging river. To both wolves and
people this is not a good thing. They all seem to understand that for
a human to become a wolf in mind is not a natural thing and not
right when it happened. The best and only example of this aspect of
Wolfkin, the Mad Dog, is found in the character Noam in the books.
Tested by both Moiraine and Perrin, Noam was found to have lost all
connection to his former humanity. He was overwhelmed and lost within
the wolf nature of his mind, all pathways back to his former humanity
forgotten, hidden, or destroyed completely. The Mad Dog is no longer
human in anything except their physical shape. Their thoughts,
desires, instincts, and passions are all those of a wolf with no
real memory or regard for those things they knew in their former life.
Like Noam, a Mad Dog is as liable to lash out at those they once
named friends or family as they are to lash out against strangers,
knowing nothing except that these strange people are dangerous to
them and that they should get away. Even the simplest task like
opening a door or speaking a word are lost to the Mad Dog unless it
is natural for a wolf to do. It is a truly saddening and painful
existence, being a wolf but never belonging and never even realising
the possible welcome to be found on the side of humans.

column1: At this level, the damane is one of the best-trained in the Empire.  These
highly-trained Damane are honored with the Sai'man rank, and they are very often
given special privileges that your average damane never sees.  Better living
conditions, treats, ribbons, and they may even be owned by one of the Blood, or the
Empress herself.
I.  `&C`7omplex `&B`7attle `&W`7eaves
a.  Control Weather -  If the damane has the ability to cloud dance, it will
be discovered in attempting to teach her this weave.
a.  Hail Storm -       If the damane has the ability to control the weather,
(the cloud dancing talent), then she may learn this
weave.  This weave requires strong flows of Air and
Water.
b.  Call Lightning -   If the damane has the cloud dancing Talent, she may
learn this weave.
c.  Storm of Air -     Any damane of Sai'man strength may learn this weave.
d.  Harm -             A damane must have a Talent for Healing in order to
learn this weave.  She must also have the required
'cause wounds' pre-requisite, and the 'cure wounds'
pre-requisite for that weave.  Unlike Aes Sedai,
Seanchan have no qualms about teaching this weave
to damane for use on humans.  If your damane is an
Aes Sedai and bound by oaths, she will not be able
to use this weave unless she feels her life is in
mortal peril, or only against Shadowspawn.
e.  Thunderclap -      A damane may learn this weave if she has the Cloud
Dancing Talent.  This is a complex weave, which
requires delicacy and precision in all Five Powers.
f.  Implode -          This is one of the deadlier weaves in a damane's
channeling arsenal.  It requires strength in Earth.
g.  Firestorm -        One of the deadlier weaves.  The damane will create
a storm of fire and air, usually in tornado form,
though it can be varied in such a way as to cause
fireballs to rain down, or ribbons of fire to slice
through the air.
h.  Eruption -         This is one of the deadlier weaves a damane is taught.
It requires a great amount of strength in Fire and Earth.
This can cause the earth to erupt in a violent manner,
usually with devastating consequences.  The stronger
the channeler, the more damage this weave causes.
i.  Sap Energy -       This weave can only be taught to damane who have the
Healing Talent.  It also requires the pre-requisite
weave 'refresh'.
j.  Infrigidation -    A powerful weave that can cause anything to freeze.
The stronger the channeler, the deadlier it can be.
It can also be used to freeze large areas of water,
it can be used to damage mundane weapons, and it can
be used in conjunction with other weaves.
II. `&S`7pecial `&T`7alents
Some damane have special Talents.  Sometimes, these Talents manifest only
after the sul'dam has worked with her for a time.  Sometimes, they are
immediately apparent.  A sul'dam must -always- be on the lookout for rare
talent in a damane.  Particular Talents the Seanchan value:
1.  Cloud Dancing - As mentioned above, cloud dancing is highly valued
as a talent among damane.  A damane may be promoted to
the Sai'man rank for this Talent once she is trained.

to aid ships, and to aid the growing of crops by controlling
the weather.  They can also create highly destructive storms,
and so are valued in sea battles especially.

ability to learn to use that ability to cause greater harm to
the enemy.  It is not a talent that is cultivated in damane
very often, if at all.
